bibl.title: Letter, Converse and Co. in Louisville, Ky., to J.G.M. Ramsey in Knoxville, Tenn. 1879 Nov. 5

author.name: Christian Observer, Converse & Co. Publishers (Louisville, Ky.)

bibl.note: 1879 Nov. 5 The Christian Observer, Converse & Co., Louisville, Ky., to J.G.M. Ramsey, Knoxville, Tenn. Thanks J.G.M. for sending an old poem which will appear in the Observer. Informs him that the Observer will be sent to him without charge in appreciation of his contributions to the paper.

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

keywords.term: Ramsey, J. G. M. (James Gettys McGready), 1797-1884 -- Poetry.
Christian Observer, Converse & Co. Publishers (Louisville, Ky.)

revisionDesc.change: Migrating from XML to validated TEI P5.

div.p: Thanks for your favor of Oct. 30th with the old poems We will try & return the ms. to you. It is a capital thing -- so quaint in its style, so rich in its religious experience. It will appear on the Obs. of Nov. 12th.

If you notice the address label of your paper, you will find that instead of the "date to which paid," opposite your name, there is simply a letter "c." It means that we esteem the help rendered by your pen as a full equivalent for your subscription & have ordered that no bill be sent to you. Please accept of the paper, & continue to help us in the way of correspondence whenever you can.
